title: Notifications
text:
So, since the latest update, among the laundry list of latest issues, one of the more prevalent problems people seem to be dealing with, myself especially, are the notifications. For some reason, the app won’t allow me to check beyond 20 of my notifications. I can’t see anything older than my top 20 most recent notifications, and even then, it’s not always in chronological order, but seemingly random at times. The screwiest part is this bug doesn’t ALWAYS happen. Less than 1/10th of the time, when I either close out and reopen the app, or straight up uninstall then redownload it, it will work as it’s supposed to and show seemingly all of my notifications, but again, it’s rarely that it actually works.

I know this is a bit reductive and oversimplifying things, but aren’t the purposes of updates to IMPROVE the quality and performance of the app? I most certainly think this latest update absolutely fails, and actually accomplishes the exact opposite of that goal.

title: Events are laughable
text: FB used to be my de facto planner, both locally and when traveling. I’d spend hours finding the best things to do on any given free day coming up. Now, it’s all promoted events. I can’t search by city. I’m currently at my boyfriend’s in Austin, want to plan events next week in San Antonio, BUT I CAN’T SEE THEM TO PLAN ANYTHING because it defaults to current location. I used to see what was going on in other cities before I got there - now I can’t. I also can’t search by type, and I’m generally looking for things that don’t pop to the top in their model (art openings, eclectic concerts, free outdoor stuff w/ teens, etc. - not the bar bands & major artist tour crap that’s at the top). I’m missing cool, community-building, bi-annual events like Siclovia in my own city because I don’t see them, even for organizations I follow, until it’s too late. I’m missing finding out about new groups that I might value - that’s huge. That’s how I found my tribe when I moved to a new city. This is clearly a revenue-driven decision, but one that rendered the events feature totally worthless, at least on mobile. Maybe it still works on the desktop, but who accesses FB on a computer?!?

title: App won’t open on iPad Mini 2 running iOS 12
text: The Facebook app shows that it was updated today, and now it will not open on my iPad Mini 2, which cannot run iOS 13.  It worked fine yesterday.  Please remember many people are using older devices - which really aren’t that old; I’ve only had this iPad for 3 years - and make sure your app works with the previous version of iOS as well as the current one.  UPDATE:  After reading other reviews, the app evidently doesn’t work on the newest iOS 13, either.  This app needs to be fixed ASAP! If you can’t fix the bug by tomorrow, please roll us back to the previous version!   UPDATE 2:  My phone has now installed the new version of the app and it still opens, so evidently only certain devices are affected.  This is still a big problem and needs an emergency fix!  UPDATE 3:  I followed the advice of another reviewer and deleted the app and reinstalled it; that fixed the problem and it’s working again.  Evidently the data was overloaded.  Why does this app store so much data?  There’s no need to accumulate data on my devices except to save the login cookies and maybe a few login cookies and form info for the built-in browser.

title: A great app to keep up with family and friends
text:
I’ve been on FB for a long time, and was amazed to see all of the recent bad reviews of it. The thing I like best about FB, is that you can see what family and friends are up to, check in with group pages you belong to, read articles people post, and laugh at funny memes. Different people post different things, so some friends may get political, some do not. You will see sides of people you know that have extreme positions on topics you would never have guessed. But you can keep scrolling, take a break from what they post, or defriend them. Some people are bent out of shape for getting blocked for posting fake news, but FB stepped up to letting people know when something was fake, rather than perpetuating things that aren’t true.  

Facebook is still a good app for what I always have used it for, staying in touch with family and friends.

title: Latest update hurts my heart
text:
In the latest update, the app no longer has the “share” button when you try to share a post to a group. You must individually look up and share each group, which is cumbersome and takes far more steps/time. My child is a brand Rep, and it used to be so convenient to make our promotion post and share in 5-10 groups with a few quick taps. Now, I have to individually share the post to each individual group. I understand it is probably some kind of safety feature to prevent hackers and bots and bugs, but it has really made it more difficult for us. 

Also, the new layout on the computer (not the app, but the physical website) has me all sorts of lost and confused. I’m a pretty tech-y person, but when you move everything from its relative location, it makes it much more difficult of an interface to use. 

Love the new avatars though!!! They are super fun and cute!!! Also, the new and updates privacy settings on groups are lovely!

title: Best Used for Communication
text: I used to post. Posting can be frustrating as it’s not altogether user friendly. It is fun though and my friends and family have often enjoyed my posts. One very good thing about FB for me has been rekindling old friendships and mostly staying in touch with family I might never have seen or spoken to again. A VERY good thing. Another good thing has been making new friends on vacation, work, or whatever, becoming FB friends, and just occasionally staying in touch to see how things are going or even plan a trip together (we’ve done it many times). The thing I use FB for the most now is Communications. I get involved with several different groups. A group of people can create a “Group Page” exclusively only to people allowed by the Group Creator (“Admin”). This group can then freely post meeting notices updates on group events, WHATEVER. It’s all private to that group. I’ve done this MANY times. It’s very helpful.
